abstract.text: You could manage download and upload and so more in terms of working with files.

inlineContent.text: To get a file from the cache or download it directly from the server. If you want to get a file from the cache just set
to false to search through a cache and if it has contained it, it will immediately back the file else it will download the file from the server. Call method

code: let req = FileRequest(hashCode: "XYZ...", checkUserGroupAccess: false, forceToDownloadFromServer: true)

inlineContent.text: To get an image from the cache or download it directly from the server. If you want to get an image from the cache just set
to false to search through a cache and if it has contained it, it will immediately back the image else it will download the image from the server. Call method
You could set the ideal size of an image you wish to receive inside the initializer of
To upload a file to server use
if you want to send it inside a thread. Please visit all properties that you could manage for uploading a file in class

code: let req = UploadFileRequest(data: fileData, fileExtension: ".txt", fileName: "Test", mimeType: "text/plain" , userGroupHash: "XYZ....")

inlineContent.text: To upload an image to server use
if you want to send it inside a thread. Please visit all properties that you could manage for uploading an image in class

code: let req = UploadFileRequest(data: imageData, fileName: "test.png", mimeType: "image/png" , userGroupHash: "XYZ....")

inlineContent.text: To reply to a message with uploading a file use the method

code: let replyMsg = ReplyMessageRequest(threadId: 123456, repliedTo: 567890, textMessage: "Use This File", messageType: .POD_SPACE_FILE)
let uploadFile = UploadFileRequest(data: fileData, fileExtension: ".txt", fileName: "Test", mimeType: "text/plain" , userGroupHash: "XYZ....")
Chat.sharedInstance.replyFileMessage(replyMessage: replyMsg, uploadFile: uploadFile) { uploadProgress, error in

inlineContent.text: To send a new message with uploading a file use the method

code: let replyMsg = SendTextMessageRequest(threadId: 123456, textMessage: "Use This File", messageType: .POD_SPACE_FILE)
let uploadFile = UploadFileRequest(data: fileData, fileExtension: ".txt", fileName: "Test", mimeType: "text/plain" , userGroupHash: "XYZ....")
Chat.sharedInstance.sendFileMessage(replyMessage: replyMsg, uploadFile: uploadFile) { uploadProgress, error in

inlineContent.text: To send a new image message use the method

code: let message = SendTextMessageRequest(threadId: threadId, textMessage: "Test text", messageType: .POD_SPACE_PICTURE)
let imageRequest = UploadImageRequest(data: imaageData, hC: height, wC: width , fileName: "Test.png", mimeType: "image/png" , userGroupHash: "XYZ..." )
Chat.sharedInstance.sendFileMessage(textMessage: message, uploadFile: imageRequest){ uploadFileProgress, error in

inlineContent.text: a file which is uploading right now use the method
To distinguish between a file or image set

code: Chat.sharedInstance.manageUpload(uniqueId: "XYZ...": action: .resume, isImage: false){ stringResult, completed in

inlineContent.text: a file which is downloading right now use the method
To distinguish between a file or image set

code: Chat.sharedInstance.manageDownload(uniqueId: "XYZ...": action: .resume, isImage: false){ stringResult, completed in

abstract.text: With Fanap Chat SDK you could connect to the chat server without managing the socket state and send or receive messages.
Downloading or getting a file from the Server / Cache.
Downloading or getting an image from the Server / Cache.
Manage a downloading file or an image.
Manage a uploading file or an image.
Reply to a mesaage inside a thread with a file.
Adding a participant as an assistant.
For creating, add/remove command, user bots, start/stop.
Managing contacts add, edit, delete, search, and more.
Converting lat, long to an address or searching through a map, or finding a route getting an image of lat, long.
You could Add, delete, edit, reply, forward and so many more.
Get current user details, update, set profile.
Tags are like folder for managing threads. You could Add, delete, edit and add/remove tag participans.
Managing threads create P2P, Group, Channel or delete edit and so many more.
Manage users such as get a list of roles and so more.
